Title: Wild Wild West
Author: S. S. Wilson  Brent Maddock  Jeffrey Price  Peter S. Seaman  Jim Thomas  John Thomas

Replies.Reply: Based on the Television Series "Wild Wild West"
4000 Warner Boulevard                   WARNER BROS.
Noooooooo!!!!!
The legendary Captain James West and I finally got him all to myself.
Mister West, you wouldn't be here workin' tonight, now would you?
Good.
Jim!
Problem solved.
Oh, Jim.
That's right, sugar, and you should feel free to treat him just bad.
General McGrath's boys. I thought y'all was never gonna show up.
No, no. 'Course not. Not tonight.
Ah, this hole is a safety issue.
Belle, you don't just ram a man's underbritches into a knothole.
Okay, who just made a wish?
I could sure use those clothes now.
Fought five long years with the Union Army not to hear that word again. And you boys lost, remember?
How 'bout some pants!?
Could I have a little privacy here?
Thank you.
Sorry about there not being any towels.
I said, whoa!!!
Didn't mean to startle you, ma'am.
I can see that, darlin'. Woman of your caliber probably gets top dollar, too. So here you go.
You can run along. I'll take care of McGrath.
C'mon, lady. You got the money.
This gun?
Or this one?
Thank you, sir.
Who are you?
Wrong answer.    Who are you?
Well, sir, one of us was still trying to figure out if he was a man or a woman.
It's McGrath, sir. The South is rising again. I'm gonna stop it.
McGrath's headed for New Orleans.
Figures.
Save it.   I've gotta train to catch.
Yee-haaa!!
Stop this train!! You hear me!?!
Forget the bikes, the beards, the fake boobies. Put down the needlepoint and let's settle this like men!
Really?
Get up!
Yeah?   How do you feel about a fist?
Well then, 'Mr.' Gordon, you failed.
Only one doin' any 'egressin' is gonna be you.
New Orleans.
Who?
That's a man's head!
That's a man's head.
That's a man's head!
It's McGrath.    I was right all along.
Oh yes, Massa Gordon, dats what I'll do. And I'll jus' smile and do as I's tole so those people won' ever know that I would rather shoot myself in the head than play your god damned man servant!
The only thing I need to wear is this.
Jim West does not wear a dress.
How 'bout this: I'll go as a government agent who's gonna kill McGrath.
Gordon, you looked nasty. Your breasts were all hard and stiff, and were sticking straight out like two rusty cannons on a sunken ship.
They look like shit.
I don't wanna touch 'em.   I can see I don't like 'em.
There, Gordon, you happy?
Buckwheat?   That's your problem.
Now, squeeze this. This is what a breast should feel like.
Isn't that nice?
Now touch yourself.
You know something, that's a good place to put a gun.
You know, Artemus, I think you underestimate the convenience of a pocket.
Matter of fact, got it right here.
Actually I'm, uh trying to surprise an old friend -- General McGrath. Seen him around anywhere?
Matter of fact, I do.
Well, when a man comes back from the dead, it's an occasion to stand and be counted.
I bet a man like yourself would find it difficult to keep in touch with even half the people you know.
Oh, the foy-aay. Sorry, I've never been much good at French.
Thanks for helpin' me get to the bottom of this case.
Real impressed the way you got the dance floor staked out. Maybe one of your missin' scientists'll cut in.
I found that our host, Dr.
So you enjoy the party. I'm gonna go save the Republic.
Don't grab a white lady's boobies at the big redneck dance. Is that the lesson? Well, I learned it.
Can I have everyone's attention please. I think we've had a series of major misunderstandings and I'd like to take a moment to clear them up. First, the whole drumming on the boobies thing.

Second misunderstanding. That redneck comment. I'm getting the sense that some of you took that negatively. You know, some of my best friends are whiskey-guzzling, pot-bellied rednecks just like y'all here.

That slavery thing, I don't see what the big deal was. Hell, who wouldn't want somebody to run around for them doing chores. Are you going to get your big, fat, lazy ass out of bed every morning and pick your own damn cotton.
I'll take that as a no. Darling, would it help at all if I said I thought you were a man?
Guess not.
Hang'm!?!
Scientist, huh.
Look, Rita, I'm sorry you had the wrong agent working on your case.
Heard about it. Thought it was crazy survivors' stories.
New Liberty, Illinois -- the free slave town just over the border.
That's when I vowed to follow McGrath to the end of the earth.
I was hoping to kill you myself.
What do you mean?
Where is he?   Where did he go?!
Just tell me.
On the way to Utah where our President happens to be. Maybe we oughta be worryin' about that little coincidence!
Look, all that would happen would be she'd get in our way and I'd probably wind up gettin' in the saddle with her.
Good luck on that one.
Since the first breast.
I'll spare you.
Make yourself a sandwich to take with you. You're getting off.
How could you possibly help us?
What about the foreign guys?!
Gordon, this is crazy. She doesn't know what she's talking about!
Coleman, stop the train! Miss Escobar's getting off.
I'm the impervious part.
I've got somethin' you might use.
Loveless kidnapped two chemists, that means there's gonna be explosives. He's got a metallurgist, so there's gonna be heavy armor.
So what, is he building that's gonna make the President fall to his knees and surrender the country?
What?
You said ass.
What the hell is this?
Leave my stuff alone!
They couldn't fire the cannon at us from in front. Any other questions?
Would it put you out too much to throw me a rope and hit your little secret button?
It's me, Jim. Open up!
Too damn late, is what it is.
And that would become one more reason why I'm going to kill you.
Gordon, get out your little tool kit and get this damn thing off of me!
I don't have time for this.
See?     Nothing happened.
Is it too late to take it off of me now?
When I give the signal.   Jump off the cliff into my arms.
You won't have to!
Maybe I should have stayed inside that fence another moment or two.
All right, Gordon, what's your plan? How are you gonna get this damn thing off my neck?
Isn't that why you're here?
Gordon, you don't want to do that.
I didn't do shit!
I did not do shit!
That's it --
Oh, I'm peachey. Now help me get my boot off!
Ahhhh!
Do me a favor. When you're telling this story to your grandkids, leave this part out.
Now, when I undo your belt, I'm going to run as fast as I can that way, and you run as fast as you can the other way.
Three!
you!
I do not want to spend the rest of my life looking like a meatball on a plate.
Your pocket? Why wasn't it attached to some spring-loaded something-or-other that shoots out of your ass?
Why didn't you tell me you had an 'auxiliary' tool kit?
What?!
You know, Gordon, you can be quite annoying -- flaunting that fancy education.
The Harvard thing seems pretty formal to me.
No. How did you wind up in this line of work?
She doesn't want any trouble.
The Indians taught me. I lived out here when I was a boy.
Hey -- watch --
They didn't have much to say about it. I was sent to another plantation when I was little. Ran away as soon as my legs were strong enough to take me.
They were at the camp at New Liberty.
But I'm never gonna get there with you draggin' that damn thing around!
Don't push it.
That's the Wanderer.
Yeah, it would. That's Loveless' Lair.
Nice to see an invention that actually works.
Gordon, let's ride!
How about now? There's a big spider stompin' towards our President!
Yeah. Well, the wasp had a small advantage. It could fly.
Artemus! There's no time for plans or half-cocked inventions!
'Ha, ha, ha! Hangtown gals!!!'  An immediate standing ovation. The diversion allows Coleman to unlock both Grant's and Rita's shackles.
Wait a minute. What the hell is this?
Mmm-hmm.
No, Arte.   Right now, we need a plan.
You're not makin' me feel any better.
He's just a little nervous 'cause no one's ever flown before.
If you had to get one right, I'm real glad it was this one.
Go down, down there!
Shut up and go down there, will ya?
What does your boy da Vinci say about puttin' this bird down?
Take out as many bad guys out as you can.
Why not? Well, I guess maybe I'd rather see what happens when I stuff your ass into that cannon up there and fertilize the landscape.
So, I guess you're the one who's gonna give me my whoopin'.
Pfft.   I got one a' those.
But you've got two of those.
Damn.
No more Mister Knife guy!
I just made that up.
Don't forget your shovel!
Is that all you got for me, Loveless?!
Uh, I just threw my shovel out.
Noooo.
Sorry.
You guys just don't get out enough.
When you get right down to it, Loveless, you just can't beat a good pair of legs.
Better than a fountain pen, don't you think.
By the way, your chivalry's about to be tested.
Now that's the ol' doctor I know!
I don't know.    Guess I'm stumped!
Ah, don't be afraid, Loveless.
Good one, Loveless.   I didn't think of that one.
Allow me to make that decision easy on you, Loveless. Because I want to see you dead a hell of a lot more than I want to live.
You were right. Let's cut this conversation short!
Now that looked like it hurt.
Rita!   You look great.
Texas? Why're you going back there? Why don't you come with me back to Washington?
She's not really an entertainer, remember?

shrinks back from the moronic ribaldry. The Toulouse Lautrec lighting only accentuates her garish hair and makeup, identifying her as a SOILED DOVE. A whore -- not to put too fine a point on it. She's trying not to make eye contact with two men seated at a table across the parlor.
Still not interested.
That doesn't mean a girl can't have high standards.
Pack'er up good, Virgil.    Next stop N'Orleans.
caught on the WATER TOWER LEG.    It CREAKS.
My employer, here in a brothel?
You'll meet him when the time --
Get Escobar out of here!
Federal agents inside, sir!
You drive a hard bargain, lady.
But you gotta be interested.
Hey, c'mere!   Who the hell are you anyway?!
sails onto the runaway wagon. As he pulls himself into the back, he gives the shivering Saloon Girl a tip of his hat -- now on his head.
Damn. He lets Miss East concentrate on what she's doing, which from the SOUNDS O.S., doesn't appear to be a demonstration of the correct way to butter corn.
suddenly contorts his upper torso just as an EXPLOSION rips the back of the chair where his head would have been.
West grabs for the halter.
Good. You're going to be my little doggy. And when I say 'speak,' you tell me everything I want to know. Understood?
Woof!
All right, little doggy. Sit up.
Now tell me who's in the sack next door. Is it the scientist, Dr.
Watch the swirling spiral!   Lie down, bad dog!
Leave him right there.
I'm no lady! I'm a U.S. Marshal!
Marzipan, isn't it?
I call it the Bi-axle Nitro-
Avant!!!
Thanks for dropping in.
As a matter of clarification, this isn't needlepoint. This is.
But it hasn't been really tested empirically yet.
I must tell you, Mr. West, I've always felt that allowing a situation to degenerate into physical violence is a failure on my part.
I'm sorry, Mr. West, you brought this on yourself.
I love this train!
Perhaps the President was right about us putting aside our petty differences.
'The opposite is beneficial, from things that differ comes the fairest attunement.' Aristotle.
That's my veal reduction sauce!
Shall we let Professor Morton decide?
Morton's last image!
How about this? You could come as my man servant?
How about this? You could come as my man servant.
I have a horse costume.
You could be the head.
Then what's your plan?
An armed, Negro cowboy costume, how creative. In a room full of white Southerners, you oughtta fit right in. You might even win first prize!

Listen to me. The art of disguise is what's going to get us into that party, thus allowing us to find these kidnapped scientists before they're forced to create something that will destroy this great country.

Now you and I are the chosen ones, Jim. We're under direct orders from the President himself. And our mission is clear: Save our country. Our freedom is at stake and this is our duty as men. Now, you go as a riverboat captain and I'll be a saloon girl.
But I was propositioned by three men.
These are a work of art.
Touch them.
What, are you afraid you're wrong? Touch my breasts.
Not so rough.    The buckwheat'll come out.
What are you doing?
Very nice.
You win.   I'm hard.
I was just going to jot down a thought.
But then, where would I keep my notepad.
I'm a special U.S. Marshal on assignment from the President.
Too late. The 'dungeon' is cleaned out. It was the first place I checked, right after I sampled the gumbo. Bit heavy on the okra.
Hey-yaa!!!
This is Rita. I found her locked in a cage in Loveless's bedroom.
That's where I know you from!
You saw it?
What survivors? There aren't any here.
We wouldn't have known where Loveless was going if it wasn't for her. Seems a bit ungracious.
Funny that you say that. Because I thought she was more interested in me.
How long has she been here?
I am so embarrassed.
By all means.
The Louisiana Purchase?
Queen Isabella of Spain.
I assure you, Rita, an attack by Loveless would be an exercise in futility.
Hardly. Completely armor-
An innocent billiard ball this way.
A bedside heater.
Rita. She    needs a bedside heater.
Such a pleasant girl.   A real breath of fresh ass.
Stay back here, take cover!
I took the liberty of installing it while you were sleeping.
Jim, we're the ones chasing Loveless, correct?
Then perhaps you could explain what they're doing behind us.
I taught him how it worked.
That's not a good one to wish for.
Don't move!
What have you done with Rita?
Wait, I have an auxiliary tool kit!
Head for that gully!
Are you crazy?! Do you see what's down there?
Oh shit!
Excuse me?

-- That wouldn't have been any fun for a certain somebody, and I won't mention any names -- Jim West! -- who decided to take me on a bracing romp through a cornfield and play a fanciful game of hide and seek with serrated, spinning death discs, while our only mode of transportation is in the hands of a sadistic madman with weapons of mass destruction, who kidnapped Rita, and is on his way to kill our President and take over the country!
You want to get that collar off?
Oh, but I do.
That's odd. What did you do?
No, you must've reversed the polarity of the magnets.
Are you all right?
Apologies, apologies.
.  Finally, West's foot comes free. But when he sits up -- THWAP! His collar is sucked into Gordon's belt buckle.
Don't worry.
yourself!
We're going to have to discuss bathroom etiquette soon. Very soon.
Aha. My auxiliary tool kit.
Because that, my friend, would be uncomfortable.
I did tell you, but in your zeal to run and leap off a two-hundred-
What?!
Well, truth be told, I never had a fancy education -- not a formal one, anyway.
This ring? This ring isn't real.
A prop. I'm an actor. Or was. I gave it up. I went by the name of Arthur Gordon. Ever hear of me?

Replies.Reply: I decided to devote my talents to making sure that never happened again.
How come you know so much about the desert, anyway?
Now I'm really hungry.
How did your parents, who I assume were Negroes, feel about you being raised by Indians?
Did you ever see your family again?
I'll help you get him, Jim.
You have no idea where you're going, do you?
While a magneto of this power may not inspire your scientific curiosity, it does mine. Besides, you never know when it might come in handy.
Well I think our partnership is taking a big step forward. You finally admitted I was right about something.
Jim, I know I've hallucinated it several times before, so is that really the Wanderer?
Now that's impressive.
We'll see about that. The fool doesn't even realize he's trapped.
Exactly!
I'm by your side, sir.   That's what's important.
Don't worry, I'm wearing the Impermeable.
Great.
I have a dress like that.
Not to sound ungrateful, but you're a little over the top.
Was that the eight ball?
That one's an incendiary bomb.
C'mon we gotta go! We gotta ride horse! Something!
Coleman! Must you smoke when handling explosives!
We're not getting enough lift!
Yes, I do know.
Yeee-haaa!
I don't think he thought it would ever work, so he didn't get that far. I'm open to suggestions.
Sorry about that, sir. Nose up, flaps down. Have to remember that next time.
Stop this violence!
Stop or I'll shoot!
If I have to.    Yes.
Not exactly.
Ravishing, a vision.
What's that, Jim?
That's easy for you to say. She didn't walk off with your best dress.
West is blocked from chasing McGrath, Gordon from going after Hudson. West tries to push her aside.
Scream. Scream. My head. I'm dying. Scream. Moan. Scream.
So Miss Lippenreider informs me.
Don't you just hate that song?
Perhaps the lovely Miss East will keep you from being a slave to your disappointment.
Your men will have their weapons tonight. And my promise that they will be part of the greatest military victory of this century!
And so you shall.
Well, General, it's been a long journey from New Liberty.
Yes, and so do I. So do I.
What was that nickname again?
Munitia, make note. Turret speed needs to be accelerated!
General, I understand your distress. But believe me, those men are not dying senselessly. It is for a far greater cause than you can imagine.
Bloodbath McGrath indeed.
Well, that concludes the festivities. Ladies, feed him to the crabs.

But, my friends, that tank is just a little ol' toy compared to what this country's greatest scientists are cooking up for me next. So if I've piqued your interest, bring 1000 kilograms of your country's gold to Spider Canyon four days from now.
Now if you'll excuse me, I've got a tank to catch.

If you don't want to miss the ride, have the last payment of 1000 kilograms of your country's gold in my hands no later than Friday. That's when I make our little proposal to President Grant. One I'm ever so confident he's gonna accept.
Au revoir, adios, and ta-ta!

Replies.Reply: Amazonia, shall we disabuse our friends of the notion that one's problems are solved when we see the light at the end of the tunnel!
Fire away!
Close the fire door!
Good morning, gentlemen! I trust you slept well.
Rita, is it? How familiar! Rita is sleeping off the after-effects in the stateroom.
Yes, Mr. West, I'm sure a well-
What a marvelous train! You don't mind if I borrow it, do you, gentlemen?
Isn't that a coincidence?    I miss me, too.
Well, isn't this a coincidence!
I have a humble abode nearby, and I hope you'll accept my hospitality. I have a little proposition to make.
The unconditional and immediate surrender of the United States of America to the Loveless Alliance.
. He calmly lights a cigar on the flaming train, strides up to the other Grant, and shouts up at Loveless.
Now just who are you?
Take them both!!!
Bonjour, buenas tardes and good day! Great glorious day! A day of healing for the wrongs that have been done to us all!
Manhattan for a handful of beads?
And a tiny piece for me to retire on.
My partner nations insist that we make this as legal as possible.
Well, sir, we're at loggerheads then, aren't we? And I suppose the threat of death to someone with your valorous war record, would mean nothing.
Shoot him in the head.
A new girl!   What a nice surprise!
Ebonia! Why are you so cruel to me?

Replies.Reply: Kill him!
Him! Him! The girl!
It's not the first time y'all have been burned in America.
Mr. President, I'll ask you once again. Sign the surrender or I decimate this town!
I find the sound of people screaming while they get blown to smithereens, ruins the ear for music. Don't you?
Commence firing!
Well, Mr. President. Have you had enough yet? Would you like to sign the surrender or shall we set a course for Denver? Wichita?
Munitia!   Munitia!!!
Lippenreider, take over the controls.
We may not have a woodshed on board, but that boy is gonna get a whoopin' anyway!
Two pair always beats a pair.
Hmmm.   Well, that hit a nerve.
A mother, perhaps? A father?
It feels so good to stretch my legs.
I likes to beat my feet on the Mississippi mud!
You expect to kill me with that little pea shooter?
Why is it, that I'm unafraid?

I believe you gentlemen are the polar opposites of a moral dilemma and I'm stuck in the middle. On one end, we have Mr. West, a man of primitive vigours uncomplicated by intellect. And on the other, there's Mr. Gordon. A man of ideas, but unlike myself, lacks the passion to kill for them.
I'm right about you, aren't I, Gordon? And that's why I'm gonna kill your friend here.
After all that, you missed.
After I kill ya, I swear I'm gonna boil you down to axle grease!
Well, I'll be a monkey's uncle.
And I'm so cotton-pickin' afraid of heights. They just give me the spooks!

But, of course, I would die along with you. I guess the only thing that I can take comfort in is the hope that you would hit those rocks a second before me and I could enjoy immeasurable bliss before I vanish.
Weeeeeeeeeest!!!!
Winning the war may have got you forty acres and a mule, but you can't just traipse into the President's office. Now gimme that gun.
Gentlemen!
Don't make Captain West any later for his appointment than he already is!
Drink, cigar?
I hear you let General McGrath get away?
Artemus Gordon.
Of course I know him, he's the best marshal I've got! He's a genius.
Gordon has proven himself time and again as a very cunning operator with a rapacious intellect.
I am the President of the United States!
Will somebody tell me what the hell this stunt is all about!?!
You're clever, Gordon. One day it'll get you killed.
Working together will be good for both of you.
You work the way your Commander In Chief tells you to work.
The fact is, gentlemen, you've both been working on the same case all along. Why did it take you so long to realize it?
'General Grant, the scientists that you seek are in my employ --
This letter was delivered inside this.
Wait!
Gentlemen! I'm leaving today for Utah where the transcontinental railroads will be joined at Promontory Point.
For the first time the United States will truly be united.
You have a week. Dismissed!
Yes, Dr. Loveless, what can I do for you today?
Flank him, left and right.
What proposition is that?
I didn't realize we were at war.
Gordon, you've got a lot of brass.
Never will I sign that paper, never will the United States ever surrender!
You've had my answer.
Keep that surrender handy. I think you're going to need it!
Son, never apologize for saving a President's life.
Drop 'em.
We'll be joining them in a moment if you can't stop that thing!
I've signed into law the creation of an agency whose sole duty is to protect the President and the country from lunatics like Loveless.
Welcome to the Secret Service, Agents No. 1 and No. 2.
I don't think that matters very much, do you? Gordon? Besides, you'll have plenty of time to discuss it on your new assignment.
See you back in Washington.
Well, I'm taking it of course.
stands in the doorway, hands on hips, surrounded by his house detectives -- their guns drawn.
The President has put a private train at your disposal. Engine number five, track six.
Mr. Gordon, the item you requested.
Knock each other about all ya please, but harm my train and I'll douse ya like dogs.
Well then, let's get on about our business, shall we, gentlemen?
I knew it. Well, I'll have no part of it!
Federal officers, bah!
Aye, sir!
Who the hell's Miss Escobar?
Half-naked?
We're not puttin' anybody off.
We have Loveless, gentlemen!
Go, Ebonia, go.
Captain West.
This is diabolical! They've got the President and I've still got that silly song in my head!
Here's a coupla bon voyage presents.
The white blur in the man's pocket is now focused. We can see that it's the top of a piece of paper. He reads the writing on it.

Suddenly, Gordon shoots the cuffs off his jacket. Out of one sleeve comes a pen. Out the other, a small pad of paper. They are both connected to a spring-loaded metal gizmo up his sleeve. West reacts, drawing his pistol up into Gordon's face.
You got about as much chance of havin' an invitation as him.
Really?
I'm Rita. I was hired here as an entertainer. Not that I'm complaining, but what are you doin' in here?
If you're so special, how come you're lookin' up here when Loveless has 'em all workin' down in the dungeon?
Get me out of here and I'll take you down there.
Excuse me?
He's impulsive, James.
Excuse me, I think I'm going to be sick.
That's a nice way to talk to people.
Well, I know that.
I'll tell you if you take me along.
The girls at the mansion. They talk.
This is fantastic. You can cut it with a fork! How'd you cook it?
They were mad about something, you know? Something about a real bad deal in Louisiana on purpose.
And Queen somebody-somebody of France got swindled.
I'm a frightened, starving, half-
Please, Jim. My father's the only family I've got. What am I supposed to do? Sit home and wait for news he's been killed? Or go do something! What would you do, Jim?!
I know you'd never let him take me back. I've seen you shoot.
Speaking of sleeping, I'm pretty tired. Artemus, do you think I could borrow something to wear?
What's going on?
You know you could put a gun on that thing.
I won't let Loveless take me again! I'd rather be dead!
Please, Artemus, don't leave me alone!
It's a trick, I know Loveless.
I kinda missed you.
Queen of Spain. King of France.
Artemus!
Serves you right for staring at them.
Meet me after the show!
I can't go with either of you.
It's not that you both don't have your attributes.
You're so sophisticated and such a wonderful cook.
Professor Escobar's not my father.
I didn't think so.
At least you still have each other.
You applied for the position.
A bucket for the minister, please!
Soon you all can fly again. This time with little angel wings.
Do not be selfish and stupid. He always spoils his new girl.
West. Let go of my leg! Gordon.
West. How do you know it's not just bullshit? Gordon. Step over the fence and find out. Rita and I will put flowers on your grave every year.
Change gear ratio from 2.2 to 2.8!
I have them square in my sights, sire.
Nitro this time, sire.
Shut up and listen to a real genius!
Are you here alone, Mr. West?
Tonight's his coming-out party.
See anybody that looks familiar?
I said to meet me in the foyer.
McGrath paces in front of Loveless's desk.
interest.

eases in, stops at what he sees. And it sure ain't scientists. Beside the bed, locked in an iron disco-like cage, is Rita, still wearing her scanty outfit. Gordon squints at her, gives a charming smile.
West leans into Gordon's ear.
Looks like we're gonna have to teach y'all a little lesson on how to behave in polite society.
Hang him!
McGRATH Go straight to hell, sir!

walks slowly across West's outstretched hand.

West and Gordon swooping down low. West unfastens BOMBS from his vest, waits for the right moment. As they swing past the Tarantula cannon, he drops them.

just showed up. He swings his wrench at West's head.
